title: Buddhism Introduction
text:
Buddhism, founded by Siddhartha Gautama (the Buddha), is a spiritual tradition originating in India.
It centers on the Four Noble Truths, which diagnose suffering's causes and propose a path to its end
The Eightfold Path outlines moral and mental guidelines for living a virtuous and mindful life.
Buddhists seek to attain Nirvana, a state of ultimate enlightenment, through meditation and self-awareness.
Buddhism has diverse branches, including Mahayana, Theravada, and Vajrayana, each with its own interpretations and practices.
